name: avocation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
something that a person does as an interest or hobby and that is not that person's regular job: The last section of the questionnaire has a space for us to list our avocations and interests. She started painting six years ago as an avocation, and next week her paintings will be displayed in a gallery exhibition for the first time.
More examplesFewer examplesIn retirement, he has found more time to pursue his avocations, like hunting and fishing. Cave exploring became a serious avocation for him when he was fourteen, and he's been doing it ever since. Although he no longer works as a mechanic, he continues to repair cars as an avocation.
